title: Been Down So Long It Looks Like Up to Me
description: A witty, psychedelic, and telling novel of the 1960sRichard Fariña evokes the Sixties as precisely, wittily, and poignantly as F. Scott Fitzgerald captured the Jazz Age. The hero, Gnossus Pappadopoulis, weaves his way through the psychedelic landscape, encountering-among other things-mescaline, women, art, gluttony, falsehood, science, prayer, and, occasionally, truth.For more than seventy years, Penguin has been the leading publisher of classic literature in the English-speaking world.
